etymologies: Old English titul, reinforced by Old French title, both from Latin titulus ‘inscription, title’. The word originally denoted a placard or inscription placed on an object, giving information about it, hence a descriptive heading in a book or other composition

definitions: the name of a book, composition, or other artistic work

examples.text: the author and title of the book

shortDefinitions: name of book, composition, or other artistic work

definitions: a caption or credit in a movie or broadcast

examples.text: Rumbelows will get exclusive sponsorship with opening and closing titles

shortDefinitions: caption or credit in film or broadcast

definitions: a book, magazine, or newspaper considered as a publication

examples.text: the company publishes 400 titles a year

shortDefinitions: book, magazine, or newspaper considered as publication

definitions: a name that describes someone's position or job

examples.text: Leese assumed the title of director general

shortDefinitions: name that describes someone's position or job

definitions: a word such as Senator or Dame that is used before someone's name, or a form that is used instead of someone's name, to indicate high social or official rank

examples.text: he will inherit the title of Duke of Marlborough

shortDefinitions: word such as Lord or Dame that is used before someone's name

definitions: a word such as Mrs. or Dr. that is used before someone's name to indicate their profession or marital status

examples.text: the title Professor is reserved for one or two members of a department

shortDefinitions: word such as Mrs or Dr that is used before someone's name to indicate their profession or marital status

definitions: a descriptive or distinctive name that is earned or chosen

examples.text: Nata's deserved the title of Best Restaurant of the Year

shortDefinitions: descriptive or distinctive name that is earned or chosen

definitions: the position of being the champion of a major sports competition

examples.text: Davis won the world title for the first time in 1981

shortDefinitions: position of being champion of major sports competition

definitions: a right or claim to the ownership of property or to a rank or throne

examples.text: a local family had title to the property
the buyer acquires a good title to the merchandise

shortDefinitions: right or claim to ownership of property or to rank or throne

definitions: (in church use) a fixed sphere of work and source of income as a condition for ordination.
shortDefinitions: (in church use) fixed sphere of work and source of income as condition for ordination

definitions: a parish church in Rome under a cardinal.
shortDefinitions: parish church in Rome under cardinal

definitions: give a name to (a book, composition, or other work)
